metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10574 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Janus through 0.9.1. janus.c tries to use a string that doesn't actually exist during a "query_logger" Admin API request, because of a typo in the JSON validation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10574` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

janus - 1.0.4-1
janus-demos - 1.0.4-1
janus-tools - 1.0.4-1
libjs-janus-gateway - 1.0.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: janus package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.4-1').
